hm.binkley.dao

Class SimpleDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • hm.binkley.dao.SimpleDAO

  • public class SimpleDAO
extends Object
    A very simple DAO wrapper for using Spring transactions and JDBC template, designed for lambda use. Example: 
     SimpleDAO<String> someColumn = new SimpleDAO(transactionManager);
 String columnValue = someColumn.dao(
        (jdbcTemplate, status) -> jdbcTemplate.queryForObject("sql here", String.class);
    Author:
    B. K. Oxley (binkley)

      • getJdbcUrl

        @Nullable
public String getJdbcUrl()
                             throws org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException,
                                    org.springframework.jdbc.support.MetaDataAccessException
        Gets JDBC URL for this transaction manager. This uses two connections, managed within.
        Returns:
        the JDBC URL or null if not applicable for the data source
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if JDBC fails
        org.springframework.jdbc.support.MetaDataAccessException - if JDBC database metadata fails

      • daoMaybe

        public final <T> Optional<T> daoMaybe(@Nonnull
                                      SimpleDAO.Dao<List<T>> dao,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      java.util.function.Function<Integer,org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException> wrongSize)
        Runs the given dao within Spring transaction, requiring 0 or 1 results.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the callback
        Parameters:
        dao - the dao callback, never missing
        wrongSize - the exception factory for 2 or more results, never missing
        Returns:
        an optional of the return
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if the results are the wrong size
